news.text: Just had a great day at the beach!

Tweet: Top stories in AI today:

-Nvidia Neuralangelo AI turns video into 3D worlds

-TIME’s new cover warns of AI extinction
-11 fresh new AI tools & resources

Read more here: https://therundown.ai/p/nvidia-neuralangelo…

Tweet: Regular ChatGPT generated text is generic and unimpressive.

Many people don't know this, but you can train ChatGPT to write exactly like you.

Here's how to do it in six easy steps:

Tweet: Step 2: Open ChatGPT and use this prompt.

This tells ChatGPT that the following prompts will be for learning your writing.

You can copy the entire prompt in the image's ALT text below.

Tweet: Step 1: Collect some samples of your writing.

I write a daily AI newsletter (link in bio), so I'll be using that as my writing sample.

You can use emails, documents, essays, or anything else you've written.

The KEY is to use your best writing pieces. ChatGPT will learn it.

Tweet: Step 4: Type "FINISHED" when you're done.

Once you've fed ChatGPT enough writing (I recommend 5 pieces minimum), type "FINISH" to let ChatGPT know you're done.

Tweet: Step 3: Feed ChatGPT your sample writing.

Simply paste your best writing pieces, and wait for ChatGPT's "CONTINUE" response before pasting more.

You can train it with as little as two pieces, but the more writing you provide, the better the output will be.

Tweet: Step 6: Test your newly trained chat. 

ChatGPT is now trained on your writing style. 

Try testing ChatGPT to write an article on a topic based on your newly named style and see how accurate it is.

Example prompt: "Write a paragraph on [Vancouver] using [The Rundown Style]"

Tweet: Step 5: Name your style.

Since I used my writing pieces from my newsletter, I'm going with "The Rundown Style."

Tweet: This prompt was taken straight from my advanced ChatGPT guide.

It's about 20x the size of this thread and contains all the most useful prompts in one spot.

Auto-sending it to everyone for free right now when you sign up for my AI newsletter: https://therundown.ai/subscribe

Tweet: One last thing- contrary to popular belief, this thread was NOT free.

I spent all day making this, so I'm hoping you honor the gentlemen's agreement:

1. Follow me 
@rowancheung
 for more
2. Retweet the tweet below to share with your friends

Tweet: AI is everything everywhere all at once.

No more siloes, just the one.

Tweet: What is a "cup"? To LLMs, it is a word. But to us, it is a full sensory package: the visual appearance, the 3D topology, the ceramic texture of the handle, the sound of it landing on a table.

To gain a far deeper understanding of concepts, the next-gen AI needs to develop…Show more

Tweet: The entire motion capture industry is about to change.

4DHumans utilizes a fully "transformerized" network, HMR 2.0, for human mesh recovery. This network is capable of analyzing a single image or video and creating detailed 3D models of the people in it. 

These 3D models are… Show more
